intro: Papuacalia aurea subsp. aurea, commonly known as the golden papuacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils.
